result.execSummary:
The defendant George Clinton Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Repeater, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).
  • Endanger Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Discharge Firearm into Vehicle or Building) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(2)(a).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality, Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 5+ Yrs)], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality, Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 5+ Yrs)], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 5+ Yrs), Habitual Criminality], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).
  • 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality, Use Dangerous Weapon (Felony 5+ Yrs)], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Restitution set at zero,  with the exception of Cierra S. which will be determined at hearing on 1/16/2015 at 1:30 p.m. in Br. 15.

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay DNA surcharge, court costs, victim witness surcharges.  To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid by 12/12/2057.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, consecutive to counts two, three, four and six; concurrent to count five.  Credit for 240 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications.
Successfully complete a cognitive thinking behavioral modification program., parenting program, and an anger mangement program.

AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.
*Conditions apply to all counts/case.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay related surcharge.  
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, consecutive to counts one, three, four and six.  Credit for zero days.

charges.descr: Endanger Safety by Use of Dangerous Weapon (Discharge Firearm into Vehicle or Building)

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, consecutive to counts one, two, four, and six.  Credit for zero days.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, consecutive to counts one, two, three, and six. Credit for zero days.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, concurrent to counts one, two, three, four and six. Credit for 240 days.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, consecutive to counts one, two, three and six.   Credit for zero days.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant George Clinton Wilson in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant George Clinton Wilson in custody.  Marissa Luz Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
  Sentencing Proceeded. Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. Additional statements by: John S and Latasha B.
AS TO COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 15 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 10 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, consecutive to Counts 2, 3, 4, 6, but concurrent to Count 5, credit for 240 days. 
AS TO COUNT 2:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 10 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 5 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, consecutive to Counts 1, 3, 4, 6,  credit for 0 days.
 AS TO COUNT 3:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, consecutive to Counts 1, 2, 4, 6,  credit for 0 days.
 AS TO COUNT 4:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, consecutive to Counts 1, 2, 3, 6, credit for 0 days.
 AS TO COUNT 5:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, concurrent to Counts 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, credit for 240 days.
 AS TO COUINT 6:
The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 6 YEARS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS, consecutive to any other sentence, consecutive to Counts 1, 2, 3, and 6, credit for 0 days.
 Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
-Restitution set at zero with the exception of Cierra S, which will be determined at a restitution hearing
-Court costs and victim/witness surcharges are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 12/12/2057; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge  to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid by 12/12/2057; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.
CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Mental health assessment and any recommended treatment to include any couseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications
-Employment or school
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Successfully complete a Parenting Program
-Successfully complete an Anger Management Program
Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement

At the hour of 2:14 pm the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdict of GUILTY AS TO COUNTS 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, and 6 which was then read.  Court polled and discharged the jury.  Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgment not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgment of conviction. Court found that the repeater has been established. Court advised the defedant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until hius civil rights have been restored. Court ordered a presentence report without recommendation. Case calendared for SENTENCING on 9/11/2014 at 1:30 pm. 
  Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant George Clinton Wilson in court with attorney Richard J Johnson.  Defendant George Clinton Wilson in custody.  Nathaniel Adamson for Marissa L Santiago appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Tracy Becker-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers. Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring. Court ordered defendant remains at home at all times.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances (no alcohol) without a valid prescription, or no dangerous weapons or firearms.   Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Cierra S., Clarence W., Jasmine S. Keyara A., Eric W., Piccola P., and Anthony H.
